DOC.brief_summary: The goal study demonstrate feasibility use novel , validated panel Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer ( NSCLC ) histology-predictive gene ( `` A/S signature ) diagnostic tool use small-volume Fine Needle Aspirate ( FNA ) biopsy . Objectives : 1 . To establish FNA biopsy requirement FNA-based subtype classification NSCLC . 2 . To define `` fixed statistical model '' histologic subtype prediction NSCLC . Study method : To establish FNA biopsy requirement gene expression-based subtype classification NSCLC , patient presume newly diagnose NSCLC , radiographic study clinical description favor probable diagnosis NSCLC , undergo FNA biopsy accord current standard technique . For part study , approximately 40 biopsy confirm NSCLC collect analysis . To define fixed statistical model histologic subtype prediction NSCLC , prospectively collect 50 FNAs . These FNAs represent Adenocarcinoma ( AC ) Squamous Cell Carcinoma ( SCC ) case ratio approximately 1:1 . Additional case otherwise specify ( NOS ) , encounter , may also collect later analysis . FNA sample qualify base cell number ribonucleic acid ( RNA ) yield ( depend finding primary objective ) assay QGS platform .
DOC.brief_title: Molecular Diagnostic Classification Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer From Fine Needle Aspirates
DOC.criteria: Patients undergo diagnostic FNA follow diagnostic modality utilize FNA : Transthoracic Needle Biopsy ( TNB ) , Endobronchial Ultrasound Guided Transbronchial Needle Aspiration ( EBUSTBNA ) , Transesophageal Ultrasound Scanning FNA ( EUSFNA ) . Patients must radiographic evidence presume lung cancer previously diagnose NSCLC potential recurrence . Patient undergo FNA potential NSCLC metastatic lesion also include ( e.g. , patient hepatic metastasis ) . Age > 18 year . Used define adult age independently provide consent . Ability understand willingness sign write informed consent document . Patients whose FNA biopsy unable provide subtype classification pathology nondiagnostic .
